maml:description.maml:para: Adds the utf-8 signature (BOM) to a file.
The file to add the utf-8 signature to.
The file to add the utf-8 signature to.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String containing the path to the file to be updated.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the EF BB BF at the beginning of the file, warns if it isn't found.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns whether the file is binary or text, and what encoding, line endings, and indents text files contain.

dev:type.maml:name: Any object with a Path or FullName property to use for a file location.
* Path the full path of the file.
* IsBinary indicates a binary (vs text) file.
* Encoding contains the encoding of a text file.
* LineEndings indicates the type of line endings used in a text file.
* Indents indicates the type of indent characters used in a text file.

maml:alert.maml:para: TODO: indent size, trailing whitespace, max line length, 2σ (95% max line length)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Path : A:\scripts\Get-FileContentsInfo.ps1 IsBinary : False Encoding : System.Text.ASCIIEncoding+ASCIIEncodingSealed Utf8Signature : False LineEndings : CRLF Indents : Tabs FinalNewline : True

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the detected encoding of a file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Returns details about a file's indentation characters.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

dev:type.maml:name: Any object with a Path or FullName property to use for a file location.
* Path, a string containing the location of the file.
* LineEndings, one of: CRLF, LF, CR, NEL, LS, PS, or Mixed.
* CRLF, a count of the U+000D U+000A CR LF line endings found.
* LF, a count of the U+000A LF line endings found.
* CR, a count of the U+000D CR line endings found.
* NEL, a count of the U+0085 NEL line endings found.
* LS, a count of the U+2028 LS line endings found.
* PS, a count of the U+2029 PS line endings found.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Path : A:\scripts\Get-FileLineEndings.ps1 LineEndings : CRLF CRLF : 90 LF : 0 CR : 0

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the utf-8 signature (BOM) from a file.
The file to remove the utf-8 signature from.
The file to remove the utf-8 signature from.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String containing the path to the file to be updated.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the EF BB BF at the beginning of the file, warns if it isn't found.

maml:description.maml:para: Re-encodes Windows-1252 text that has been misinterpreted as UTF-8.
The string containing encoding failures to fix.
The string containing encoding failures to fix.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String containing encoding failures to fix.
System.String containing the corrected string data.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true if a file does not appear to contain parseable text, and presumably contains binary data.

dev:type.maml:name: System.Boolean indicating that the file contains binary data.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true if a file ends with a newline as required by the POSIX standard for text files.

dev:type.maml:name: System.IO.FileInfo file or similar object to test for UTF-8 validity.
System.Boolean indicating whether the file ends with a newline.

maml:description.maml:para: Indicates that a file contains text.

dev:type.maml:name: System.Boolean indicating that the file contains text.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines whether a file can be parsed as UTF-8 successfully.

dev:type.maml:name: System.IO.FileInfo file or similar object to test for UTF-8 validity.
System.Boolean indicating whether the file parses sucessfully.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true if a file starts with the optional UTF-8 BOM/signature.

dev:type.maml:name: System.IO.FileInfo file or similar object to test for UTF-8 validity.
System.Boolean indicating whether the file starts with a utf-8 signature (BOM).

maml:description.maml:para: Returns true if a file contains at least one byte identified as a likely Windows-1252/CP1252 character value.
